==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|が|しょう|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Probably from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かしょう'}} compound {{m|ltc|畫商|tr=hwɛH syang}}. Compare modern {{etyl|zh|-}} traditional {{m|zh|畫商}} and simplified {{m|zh|画商|tr=huàshāng}}.

Alternately, may have been coined independently in Japan as a compound of {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=かしょう'}} elements {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かしょう'|画|tr1=ga|t1=picture, painting|商|tr2=shō|t2=[[business]], [[dealings]]; [[dealer]]}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|が|しょう}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɡa̠ɕʲo̞ː]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|がしょう|hhira=ぐわしやう}}

# the [[business]] of [[selling]] [[picture]]s
# an [[art dealer]] {{qualifier|specific to pictures; does not include sculpture or other media}}
